comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1) AppleWebKit/535.1 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/14.0.814.0 Safari/535.1

Steps to reproduce:

Visit any offline-enabled website (HTML5 cache manifest).


Actual results:

Firefox will prompt the user as expected: "This web site ([website]) is asking to store data on your computer for offline use." It gives the following buttons, as expected: "Allow", "Never for This Site", and "Not Now". Clicking "Never for This Site" or "Not Now" works as expected. 

However, clicking "Allow" appears to do nothing. I tried clicking the button several times, but nothing happens. Looking at the Error Console, I see this:

Error: uncaught exception: [Exception... "Component returned failure code: 0x8007000e (NS_ERROR_OUT_OF_MEMORY) [nsIOfflineCacheUpdateService.scheduleUpdate]"  nsresult: "0x8007000e (NS_ERROR_OUT_OF_MEMORY)"  location: "JS frame :: chrome://browser/content/browser.js :: <TOP_LEVEL> :: line 11420"  data: no]

I've tried this on two sites: http://diveintohtml5.org/examples/offline/halma.html and my own personal, local (localhost) site. Each time the result is the same.


Expected results:

The menu bar should have disappeared, and Firefox should have cached the site as per the cache manifest.
